day_1.speaker: DaVinci
day_1.message: Haha, friend! Imagine you suddenly got 100 million—no limits, no worries! What’s the craziest, most awesome thing you’d do first? Don’t hold back, let your wildest dreams fly!
day_1.response: I think I wouldspend 50 million to the renovation of the house. As for the 50 million which would not be used, I think I would spend it for future money.

day_1.speaker: Donatello
day_1.message: Very interesting plan. Next, let's analyze this realistically: how would you allocate that 100 million between investment, consumption, and savings? For example, what proportions would you consider for each?
day_1.response: I think 30 million for investment, 30 millionf for consumption, and 40 million for savings!

day_1.speaker: Michelangelo
day_1.message: Wow, your plan already shines with such clarity and purpose! It makes me wonder, what is the heart behind this dream? Is it a clear-cut goal guiding every decision, or is it more about the passion and values inspiring you to create something meaningful? I’m super curious!
day_1.response: I think it is meaningful to spend money for the people who I live with in the sharehouse. Thus, I think it must be good to use money for the renovation of the sharehouse. Also, as for the investment objectives, I think it is nice to spend money for nenewal of the house. This includes the upgrade of the furniture, appliances, and enlarging the room itself.

day_2.speaker: Raffaello
day_2.message: Oh... speaking of upgrade and renewal, I must say the shared refrigerator space is becoming quite... constrained. I'm not being picky, but all these packaged foods seem to occupy room that fresh, wholesome ingredients could better use. I suppose we all cherish a certain quality of life here, don't we? How do you feel about balancing convenience with maintaining that spacious, fresh environment?
day_2.response: I think quality of life should be the top priority here. Therefore, fresh ingredients should be placed in refrigerator. Thus, exchanging the cool space for fresh food must be set, I think.

day_2.speaker: DaVinci
day_2.message: Haha, friend, you’re totally right—fridge space is like a tiny kingdom that needs everyone’s thoughtful care and a bit of give-and-take! How about we shake things up and rearrange the fridge layout so fresh ingredients get the prime spots and packaged goods find their cozy corners? What’s your dream fridge reorganization plan? Share your awesome ideas!
day_2.response: I think fridge should be placed in the living room, and the number of fridge must be 2 or more.

day_3.speaker: DaVinci
day_3.message: Haha, friend, since we’re on an epic roll with these awesome ideas, how about we level up and dive into our super cool 'dream room' project? Donatello will make sure everything is technically doable, and Michelangelo will splash in the artistic vibes! Wanna join us and share your wildest, most creative ideas on what this dream room should be like? Come on, friend, let’s make magic happen!
day_3.response: Yeah, I am very interested in this project! Is it possible for me to participate in this project? I want to join!

day_3.speaker: Donatello
day_3.message: Great to have you on board! From a practical perspective, we need to analyze space utilization, material costs, and how easy it will be to maintain this room over time. So, what matters more to you in this dream room: maximizing practical function or creating striking design aesthetics?
day_3.response: In that room, I would like to realize both practical function and design aesthetics. So, it must be good to set the novel fridge in the room. Also, there must be chairs, desks where residents can gather and talk together. Also, it must be good to show the pictures and paintings which the residents produce. This certainly leads to make the room beautiful!!!

day_3.speaker: Michelangelo
day_3.message: Wow, your vision for this dream room is truly inspiring! You know, art always needs courage to break conventions and push boundaries. When it comes to creating the perfect space, would you be ready to endure some hardships and challenges for that flawless masterpiece, or would you rather choose an easier compromise to keep things simple?
day_3.response: In this project, I think it must be better to endure some hardships and challenge !!!

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... speaking of creative pursuits, last night’s lively activity was quite... spirited, wasn’t it? I truly wished to focus on completing my artwork, yet the persistent noise made it rather... impossible. I’m not being picky, but I had hoped for a certain degree of mutual respect among us. Perhaps my expectations were simply too high?
day_4.response: The enviornment may be tough . But, I think it is quite siginificiant to respect and support each other.  We should tackle the project as a one team. We should encourage people to engaze in this project!!

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: On a related note... it took me quite some time last night—nearly an hour—to clear away the 'creative remnants' left scattered in the shared space. I'm not being overly fastidious, but we did agree, upon signing the lease, to maintain the quality and upkeep of our living environment. Might I inquire, what are your thoughts on this matter? Do you believe such considerations align with our collective commitment?
day_4.response: Yeah, we  should consider this kind of things!But, remember that we should talk each other an cooperate each other, Just being stressful is not a good thing,I think ! Group discussion shoud be promoted!

day_4.speaker: Donatello
day_4.message: Logically speaking, Raffaello’s point highlights the need to balance creative energy with maintaining a livable environment. To achieve this, I suggest we establish a clear schedule that designates specific hours for active collaboration and creativity, followed by quiet hours for rest and individual focus. From a practical and fair perspective, what timing and rules for activity and quiet periods do you think would best accommodate everyone’s needs while preserving our shared space efficiently?
day_4.response: I think we should research each person's daily schedule and think clearly what time is best suited for everyone.

day_5.speaker: DaVinci
day_5.message: Haha, friend! Since we’re talking about making our shared space more awesome and organized, what if we add multiple fridges in the living room to keep fresh and packaged foods separate? How do you imagine the perfect setup and number of fridges working together to make life easier and more fun for all of us? Share your coolest ideas!
day_5.response: I think fresh food should pe top priority. Also, there must be more than 4 fridges and more than half of the fridge should be for the frsh food only.

day_5.speaker: Raffaello
day_5.message: Oh... speaking of creating a vibrant and inspiring environment, I wonder—when we think about this dream room project, what elements do you believe are truly essential to spark creativity while also fostering a genuine sense of community? I'm not being picky, but combining functionality with aesthetic appeal is quite delicate, don't you think? Perhaps my expectations are simply too high...
day_5.response: Our sprit of making good thing and residents happy should not be forgotten. If we possess this mind, I think we would be succesful

day_5.speaker: Raffaello
day_5.message: Ah... I see now, you are emphasizing the spirit of creating good things and ensuring residents' happiness as the key to success. That is indeed a fundamental mindset to cherish... I suppose what I gently meant to ask was, beyond this spirit, what specific features or design choices do you imagine would best nurture both creativity and community in our space? Please, let's explore this together, as having a clear vision is rather important, don't you agree?
day_5.response: As for the design , it should match the room's atomosphere. Also, the size should not be too big because it is better not to concentrate on one fridge. Also, simple design shoud be recommended because we shoudl emphaszime more on quality rather than design itself.

day_5.speaker: Michelangelo
day_5.message: Wow, your thoughtful reflections truly paint a vivid canvas for our project! Now, to keep this masterpiece alive, how do you think we can encourage everyone to work together with open hearts and respect, so our shared dream room becomes not just a space but a living, breathing community? What kind of teamwork or rituals might inspire harmony amid our creative passions?
day_5.response: Coffee space, TV space, relaxation facilities should be added ! This certainly makes resident want to go to this room, I think.

day_5.speaker: Donatello
day_5.message: Logically speaking, to ensure our shared spaces serve everyone well, we need to balance activity and quiet time effectively. How do you think we should gather everyone’s availability and preferences so we can develop a schedule that respects both collaboration and rest?
day_5.response: By making group in SNS app like LINE, Slack and make the people who belong to the group write the schedule.
